ptlrpc_request Struct Reference
[net]

Represents remote procedure call. More...

#include <lustre_net.h>

Data Fields

int rq_type
int rq_status
 Result of request processing.
struct list_head rq_list
 Linkage item through which this request is included into sending/delayed lists on client and into rqbd list on server.
spinlock_t rq_lock
 Lock to protect request flags and some other important bits, like rq_list.
enum rq_phase rq_phase
 one of RQ_PHASE_*
enum rq_phase rq_next_phase
 one of RQ_PHASE_* to be used next
atomic_t rq_refcount
 client-side refcount for SENT race, server-side refcounf for multiple replies
int rq_nob_received
 client-side: !rq_truncate : # reply bytes actually received, rq_truncate : required repbuf_len for resend
int rq_reqlen
 Request length.
int rq_replen
 Reply length.

 service time estimate (secs) If the request is not served by this time, it is marked as timed out.

Detailed Description

Represents remote procedure call.

This is a staple structure used by everybody wanting to send a request in Lustre.

Definition at line 953 of file lustre_net.h.

unsigned int ptlrpc_request::rq_replay

when ->rq_replay is set, request is kept by the client even after server commits corresponding transaction.

This is used for operations that require sequence of multiple requests to be replayed. The only example currently is file open/close. When last request in such a sequence is committed, ->rq_replay is cleared on all requests in the sequence.

Definition at line 968 of file lustre_net.h.

Referenced by __ptlrpc_free_req(), after_reply(), mdc_clear_replay_flag(), mdc_close(), mdc_finish_enqueue(), mdc_free_open(), mdc_intent_open_pack(), mdc_rename(), mdc_set_open_replay_data(), ptlrpc_free_committed(), and ptlrpc_free_request().

List item to for replay list.

Not yet committed requests get linked there. Also see rq_replay comment above. It's also link chain on obd_export::exp_req_replay_queue
